result.name: joint-nutrient-study-jonus-ii-plankton-survey
result.notes:
The Jonus II programme was run to examine impacts of nutrients on the coastal 
pelagic community and consisted of a series of 7 individual cruises using RV 
Cirolana and the charter vessel Lough Voyager.

The survey was conducted in the southern North Sea, the Thames Estuary, The 
Wash, the Irish and Celtic Sea, the South-Western Approaches and the western 
English Channel.

As part of the survey aims phytoplankton and zooplankton samples were 
collected. This data consists of the numbers of microzooplankton, along with 
associated positional data and volumes filtered.

organization.name: marine-environmental-data-information-network
organization.title: Marine Environmental Data & Information Network
organization.description: MEDIN is a partnership of UK organisations committed to improving access to marine data. Our partners are both public and private sector.

result.title: Joint Nutrient Study (Jonus) II Plankton Survey

resources.description: The Cefas Data Portal contains metadata records and data sets available to download and connect to in support of our commitment to open science. Data is available in the following formats: CSV, ESRI Shapefile. The data can also be accessed via the WFS and WMS protocols.
resources.name: Cefas Data Portal
